page.title: 14TOURISM
page.content: Kemp Town is really an extension of Brighton and has few large hotels, the Royal Crescent Hotel being the notable exception. Most have less than lO rooms and charge about Â£7.5O per person per night. Most visitors stay 2 or 3 nights; they come from all over the country. Some visitors come from abroad. There are coach parties of day-trippers and conference delegates. There are good restaurants offering continental food at Â£lO-l5 a head and cheaper cafes. The 3 seafront pubs, and most of the shops cater for tourists. There is a famous nudist beach and the Marina. Seasports include fishing, windsurfing & sailing. There is a funfair with 21 different amusements. Brighton town centre is a bus ride away and coach excursions are available to places of interest in Sussex.
